column11: Tomato, onions, cabbage, okra, Chinese cabbage, mustard
column16: Agriculture department and sustainable Cape maclear
column18: The plants/crops are sprouting (coming up) strongly
column23: They want learn how to make fertilizer from manure
column25: Thinks some will fertility and some will negatively impact the soil.
column30: They look at the health of the plants and size of the plant. When the plants are about to produce fruits they apply CAN
column31: They apply at tea spoon for each plant
column34: After planting, then after two or three weeks they apply NPK. They apply NPK on each planting station. Then after another two or three station they apply CAN
column36: It wilts crops when it's applied close to the plant. When they don't have money the plants don't grow well. Overall, they like fertilizer because it's faster and grow well
column38: It dry out crops when it's applied excessively and close to the planting station
column53: I buy 15kg of 23:21 fertilizer twice a year. I also buy 15kg of CAN fertilizer twice a year. I also do the same for CAN  fertilizer
column60: Maize husks (bran) mixed with ash; Maize stalks with dry rice plants and burn it
column71: I learned this at sustainable Cape Maclear
column75: It depends on the availability of inorganic fertilizer. If they have inorganic fertilizer they don't need organic fertilizer
column80: It contains worms which eat the plant. They sometimes apply it prematurely sometimes
column82: The yield is very little ( tomato is very small)  compared to inorganic fertilizer.
column87: We heard on the radio that dry leaves are fertilizer when the fall on the farm/soil
column94: It's cheap. But., I'm for inorganic fertilizer because it's faster and gives high yield
column95: It's faster and gives high yield
column99: We are excited about the question of a possibility to learn more about agriculture to make their activities. They would like to receive animals to support supplement their business. They want to learn more about about pesticides.

column14: I didn't want to plant tomato because I didn't have fertilizer.
column18: Tomato grows well if fertilizer is applied
column23: I want to be an expert in irrigation. I like irrigation because once you have fertilizer and pesticides you move out of poverty
column30: Use NPK to make the plants grow health. Used NPK after moving the tomato from nursery. Use CAN once the plants want to start producing fruits. Heard from people and friends to use it this way
column31: They look at the size of the field. He also learn and observe from people doing this type of farming.
column34: Once I see that the plant is established/ready/health, I apply NPK. I use CAN when I see that the plants are flowering. I apply fertilizer between 30cm stations. When the planting stations are 45cm apart I put fertilizer close to plant. I see this in other fields.
column36: I used Urea once, and tomato died. It doesn't happen with CAN and NPK
column38: If you use it on crops it has negative impact. For example, Urea on tomatoes is not good
column53: Once a year 25 Kilograms. He is not getting it every year
column68: For 30 cm planting stations I use a handful of manure. For 45 cm I use the same handful but I apply it close to the plant
column80: I have faced problems with cow manure because it dry out plants when applied before the cow manure is completely decomposed
column82: Because it takes time to start working
column87: It's fertilizer made from green grass.
column91: My field is not fertile and sandy, he believes compost would help
column94: Compost can retain nutrients. Inorganic fertilizer depletes nutrients in soil
column95: Inorganic fertilizer is fast and makes plants to grow strongly fast
column99: I would like to use/try compost, I would also like to be assisted with inorganic fertilizer because it's fast and it make plants green.

column18: It's more sandy so it doesn't retain water. Also, on one part which  plants do grow strong, Health and fast. He thinks the field is sand on one part, the other is more clay and loam
column23: Wants to learn how to improve soil fertility. Wants to learn about manure and compost production
column30: I use NPk soon after the maize germinate for the maize to grow strong. I use Urea when the maize is about to produce fruits. I use CAN when urea is not available. They don't like CAN because it takes a short time for nutrients to deplete from the soil. We heard from agricultural extension workers about which fertilizer to apply.
column31: It depends on the availability of fertilizer they have. When they have more fertilizer they put more. When fertilizer is more we use a table spoon. When fertilizer is less we use a tea spoon. We were told by agricultural extension workers again. It also depends on sowing/planting method. If they use sasakawa they use a bottle top as the quantity.  The other is the three seed per station and this go with the tea spoon/table spoon application
column34: As the factors of determining the quantity
column36: When they apply fertilizer and the rain is not falling maize wilts. When they apply the fertilizer close, the maize dries out. When you start using inorganic, you have to continue using it. If you unstoppable and use organic fertilizer maize doesn't do well
column53: They buz 2 times a year 1 onve urea and once npk
column68: I don't usually use manure. This opportunity to get manure. They think manure brings back soil texture and structure. I apply a handful per station and once the field is completely applied with fertilizer I stop
column80: When I use goat directly or without process it dry out maize. I process by spraying water on the manure for 2 weeks.
column87: People say compost is fertilizer. But, I don't know how it's made. I just hear the word of compost.
column91: It's cheaper than fertilizer. We can also make it on our own without spending money
column94: It's cheaper than inorganic fertilizer. It retain nutrients while inorganic fertilizer depletes nutrients in soil.
column95: It works fast since plants grow strong and health fast.
column99: Happy that we came to ask about farming. They would be happy to learn about simple ways of making fertilizer because it's not possible now to buy fertilizer because of its high price. They want to learn more farming to teach others too

column15: I don’t fallow because it will cause famine at my house. I don't have enough land
column18: Soil porosity is very good so roots are able to penetrate. The soil also retains water that I'm able to grow plants after maize harvest (time of no rain)
column21: How to improve soil. How to take out bad nutrients (acidity) in the soil. To do this, we put ash in the soil. I also learn about bio-char making.
column23: Soil quality. Plant management from panting to harvesting. How to improve soil or make soil fertile or health.
column25: It penetrates soil thereby loosening it which is good for root growth and nutrient absorption
column27: I had enough maize stalks which provides nutrients to soil if managed properly. I placed maize stalks between ridges, and build/buried the maize stalks on new ridges..
column87: It's piling biodegradable waste and then putting ash, manure and water. You turn the mix til, you get manure. The time it takes to make compost depends on biodegradable waste. Normally, it takes 2 months to make compost.
column91: It will help me to get high yield as my crops will grow health. I think it's the only way to tackle fertilizer problems in Malawi. Also, compost help inorganic fertilizer to work in soils that are depleted for nutrients. Inorganic fertilizer doesn't work in heavy nutrient depleted soils.
column94: Compost rejuvenates or replenishes soils. You can apply compost for some time and stop, still you will get high yield. With inorganic fertilizer, you can't get yield if you didn't apply/skip it on your field
column95: It's takes a very short time to start working. It contains a certain chemical that makes crops to produce health and strong fruits.
column99: I'm happy that you came. It's motivating and I have learnt something from this conversation. Your coming has taught me that there are small things you don't, that you thing are not significant but are significant to others. This is what I have learnt from your coming.

column18: We can see that the maize is health and green. The taste of the maize is very good and of good aroma
column25: It creates space in soil which is good for aeration
column30: When we look at maize at some point it stops growing , so to get it growing we use NPK to facilitate it's growth. I learnt this from school and parents that NPK is good for maize growth. We use Urea when we see that the maize is about to produce fruits. We know that Urea is good for maize fruit growth
column31: We used to get something like a cup in fertilizer which stipulates the amount of fertilizer to be applied on planting Station. This cup is equivalent to a table spoon or 3 tea spoons. This is also common knowledge to many that we apply a table spoon or 3 tea spoons.
column34: For apply NPK 3 inches from the maize seed/plant. We apply NPK once the maize has 2 leaves. We plant one seed per hole at a distance of 30 cm apart. Urea apply when we see ngayaye, and we also see that it's producing the last leaves. The other leaves faces down, but the last one we know it since it doesn't face down. When we see this we know and apply Urea. We use the same distribution method, and quantity as NPK.
column36: When there is little water maize dries out. It needs more watering.
column38: Maize that got applied with inorganic fertilizer needs a lot of inorganic fertilizer to grow health. Maize which was applied with organic fertilizer doesn't need a lot of fertizer when used as seed.
column68: We put manure till the hole is filled. The hole is 2 between 3 and half inch. We copied this from our parents so we can't know whether this is good or bad
column80: It was taking a long time to have the maize growing health.
column82: The crops don't grow health as with inorganic fertilizer. So the maize crops/fruits and kernels are not big enough
column87: It's manure made by mixing leaves and other biodegradable materials. Then you wait for it to break down. I only hear it from people - and I have never seen it
column91: From what I heard, compost improves soil nutrients. It also restores soil. It's cheap so I can improve our farming operations.
column94: It's cheap. It restores soil and improves soil nutrient
column95: Change is guaranteed as you know when change will happen. It's also faster.
column99: We want sustainable ways of improving soil. We want to learn about fertilizer making or  compost.

column11: Maize, Soya bean , pumpkins, cow peas, groundnuts,
column15: We don't have anywhere else to farm: land is limited
column18: All crops do well in this so.
column23: Soil improvement. Crops suitability on different land
column25: I heard that worms should be mixed with manure to have good fertilizer. I heard this on the radio.
column30: Availability of fertilizer. Can is very difficult to find here. Last time I used was like 9 years ago on a different field. I got it in Mangochi then. One week after planting I apply NPK. We just think that it's good to apply NPK fertilizer. We can't apply Urea after planting because it's too strong that it wilt the maize. I apply urea after 3 weeks. Urea start working after 21 days so that’s the time the maize start producing fruits.
column31: We heard from agriculture extension workers that a teaspoon of NPK fertilizer is enough to make maize growth health. They also said a teaspoon of urea is enough to make maize produce strong and health fruits.
column33: We learn this when agriculture extension workers are distributing fertilizer. This happens at the chiefs court
column34: We apply fertilizer 10 cm away from planting Station. When we plant 3 seeds per station, the stations are 60 meters apart. When we plant 2 seeds per station, the stations are 30 meters apart. When we have more fertilizer we apply on both sides of the plants at 10 cm apart on each side. The timing has been described before
column39: It's just makes crops like pumpkins and maize grow better
column49: 75000 (I was buying fertilizer coupons from a guy who got fertilizer from the AIP program
column54: I buy one time, 5 bags of 50kgs of fertilizer
column68: Our soil is not good it needs a lot of manure. We use a handful per station
column80: Over application and under application fertilizer cause poor growth of crops. I don't know the ratios of using manure
column83: May crops grow well when I apply it on my fields
column87: It's fertilizer that is made when a pit is dug for pulling waste like leaves, sugarcane chafe and ash. No plastic should be on it. The pit should be 1×1×1 meter. You water the waste in the pit
column91: It keeps moisture in the soil. Even when rain is not enough crios doesn't wilt
column94: It keeps moisture in the soil than inorganic fertilizer. It restores or replenishes nutrients in the soil.
column95: Works fast. You are guaranteed to get high yield
column99: Happy to see you and I hope to learn more from agriculture. I hope to teach what I will learn from you to teach others.

column14: I went to Lilongwe to care for my sick brother, and the family didn't plant crops for 2 years then
column18: Some part maize grow well. Some part maize grow poorly.
column20: VAC. Don't know acynomy. It was an organisation support in agriculture and sex workers
column21: Planting of maize. Fertilizer application. Told to apply fertilizer when planting maize. Told to apply fertilizer in the amount of Coca-Cola bottle top. Fertilizer to be applied 4 or 5 cm from the planting seeds. I plant seeds 15 cm apart.
column23: Soil improvement. Soil quality - what to know which type of crops would do be in which soil
column25: Sometimes we think that worms negatively affect maize.
column30: We heard on the radio that NPK helps crops to grow well, and Urea helps crops to produce healthy fruits. Because of poor soil, we now apply NPK which was not the case in the past when soil was good
column31: I was told by people and VAC. people say a teaspoon is equivalent to Coca-Cola bottle top.
column36: Maize still grow poorly on one side even after applying fertilizer. Buried maize stalks in that area to improve soil
column57: Burying maize stalks in the ground to restore soil quality
column95: It's fast. Maize grow health and fast. Compost is time consuming
column99: Willing to use compost for free. Willing to pay K15000. Compost is made by pilling biodegradable waste, adding water and turning it over for sometime.

column15: We only have this land. If we can farm, then we have nothing
column16: Radio programs - and they give out contacts of people to reach out, but has never called
column18: It still needs fertilizer. In the last my patents were planting without fertilizer though
column23: Learn about maize farming because I feel we are not good at it. I'm saying this because we don't get enough yield. I think we can be getting 20 bags if we learn about maize farming.
column30: Availability od fertilizer. CAN is very difficult to find but it's good. When maize has 3 or 4 leaves we apply fertilizer. Urea is applied when the maize haa started producing tassels. We heard and hear this on the radio
column31: The actual size of the land. We apply 1 teaspoon on one planting station. The panting stations are 30 cm apart. We apply fertilizer 3 or 4 cm apart. We learnt this from parents. If you apply more than 1 full table spoon, then crops get wilted.
column59: Fertilizer works fine, I don't need anything else
column87: Fertilizer made of mixing inorganic fertilizer, maize bran, leaves and everything that decomposes.
column91: It can make maize grow better
column94: Can be made by oneself since it uses local materials. We can be applying fertilizer on time since we can make it ourselves
column95: It's fast to react when there's rain. It gives strong fruits
column99: I'm happy with the questions. People want to produce and harvest more yield. We would love to have an alternative of inorganic fertilizer because inorganic fertilizer is very expensive

column15: We don't have enough land. You can only do that when you have another field
column18: When there is rain maize do well.
column23: Which crops are suitable for which soils.
column25: Sometimes when we plant crops, we see many of them and still maize grow just fine
column30: Availability: It's very hard to find CAN so we use NPK instead. We hear on the radio that NPK is for plant growth. We also hear that urea is for health and strong fruits.
column31: Soil nutrient. This soil is is not so good so we use more fertilizer. We use a tea spoon of Urea, and table spoon of NPK instead of just using a tea shoot for both.
column34: We apply fertilizer 5 cm meter from the plant. We plant crops 30 cm meter apart. We simply know that this spacing is ideal for maize. We apply NPK fertilizer whennit has 3 or 4 leaves. We apply Urea when maize is about 45 cm. Our soil doesn't make grow very high - so for very good soil you apply Urea when maize is at least a meter
column36: When you apply fertilizer very  close to the plant, it wilts.
column39: Maize grow well with inorganic fertilizer
column68: Availability of manure. We ensured that we applied all the fertilizer we had.
column80: Maize wilted when I applied goat manure. But when I applied goat manure after exposed it to rainforest time, maize didn't wilt.
column83: We just don't know how to use and apply fertilizer that's why maize wilted that time. But it doesn't have any negative impact
column87: It's fertizer that is made by piling animal manure and putting water on the manure over time
column94: It's cheap and we can do it ourselves.
column95: It's fast and you get high yield all the times
column99: We are excited by your visit. This visit can also be made better if we can learn about fertilizer making. Learning is not just going to school, even visuts can also be part of learning. Just like President Kamuzu Banda used to say, you learn a lot through travelling.

column15: We don't have any other field
column18: It's hugely dependent on fertilizer and maize stalks.  You can get yield without fertilizer
column23: What type of crops do well on which type of soils. Fertilizer application - we want to know if we apply less or more
column30: Quantity of fertilizer. A 50 kg bag of CAN has less volume so is not usually inadequate. Availability of fertilizer - Sometimes NPK is not available so the use urea for basal and top dressing
column31: Size of the land. We apply handful of fertilizer till it fills up the whole field.
column34: We apply NPK after 2 or 3 week ,or when maize plant has 3 or 4 leaves. We apply urea when it's on the knee height. We apply fertilizer at a distance of 4 to 5 cm from the plant to avoid wilting of the maize. I learnt from my family
column36: It caused wilting of maize. People told us that we applied urea close to the plants, and some said the fertilizer was very powerful
column39: Fertilizer is okay, but maybe we don't know how to use it.
column59: Other people say animal manure is not good for farming
column87: Is fertilizer made by mixing maize brain and other biodegradable waste in a pit for 40 days, and using it later after breakdown as fertilizer. You use water. Some say it's bad because it brings worms that eat maize
column91: We expect it to supplement inorganic fertilizer. Hence, it can reduce the use of inorganic
column94: It restores soil nutrients. It's cheap
column99: We expect to learn more from you. We are farming without proper knowledge
